other_tests.findings: A white tumor body measuring approximately 2.5 cm was found at the cardia and gastric bottom, closely connected to the muscularis propria. No obvious bleeding observed on the wound surface.

other_tests.procedure_name: Radical gastrectomy plus lymph node dissection
other_tests.findings: Postoperative pathological results revealed a tumor size of 2.8 cm Ã— 1.5 cm identified as low-differentiated carcinoma. Immunohistochemical results showed lymphoepithelial carcinoma, infiltrating the muscular layer, without tumor thrombus and nerve invasion in vessels.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-gastrectomy pathology revealed erosion near the cardia of the stomach bottom, granulation tissue formation, inflammatory cell infiltration, fibrous tissue hyperplasia, and residual lymphoepithelioma-like cancer.
